skill.name: markitdown
skill.description: Convert files and office documents to Markdown. Supports PDF, DOCX, PPTX, XLSX, images (with OCR), audio (with transcription), HTML, CSV, JSON, XML, ZIP, YouTube URLs, EPubs and more.
skill.summary: Convert files and office documents to Markdown. Supports PDF, DOCX, PPTX, XLSX, images (with OCR), a...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns were found. Network usage is limited to documented API clients for optional AI features.

content.value_statement: Documents come in many formats and are hard to process consistently. This skill converts files into structured Markdown for review and analysis.
actual_capabilities: Convert single files to Markdown using MarkItDown
Batch convert directories with extension filters and parallel workers
Add AI image descriptions via OpenRouter with custom prompts
Convert literature PDFs with metadata front matter and optional year folders
Generate an index and JSON catalog for converted papers
Enable MarkItDown plugins for extra converters
limitations: Requires MarkItDown and format specific dependencies to be installed
AI image descriptions need an OpenRouter API key
OCR and audio transcription require extra system tools
Output fidelity depends on the source file quality and layout

use_cases.title: Convert papers for review
use_cases.description: Turn PDF papers into Markdown with metadata for fast literature review.

use_cases.title: Batch convert archives
use_cases.description: Process a folder of mixed documents into a searchable Markdown set.

use_cases.title: Extract tables from files
use_cases.description: Convert spreadsheets to Markdown tables for quick inspection.

prompt_templates.title: Basic conversion
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert report.pdf to Markdown and save it as report.md with the original title in a header.

prompt_templates.title: Batch folder
prompt_templates.prompt: Batch convert all PDF and DOCX files in ./docs to ./md_output and show a summary of successes.

prompt_templates.title: AI image descriptions
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert slides.pptx with AI image descriptions using the scientific prompt type and save as slides.md.

prompt_templates.title: Literature workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert all PDFs in ./papers to ./literature_md, organize by year, and create an index.

output_examples.input: Convert my presentation to Markdown with slide summaries.
output: Title and source metadata at the top
Clean text extracted from slide content
Optional AI image descriptions for figures

best_practices: Install only the format dependencies you need for faster setup
Use streaming conversion for large files to reduce memory use
Provide clear filenames for better metadata extraction
anti_patterns: Passing text mode streams to convert_stream
Using AI descriptions without an API key configured
Expecting perfect layout fidelity for complex PDFs

faq.question: What file types are supported?
faq.answer: PDF, DOCX, PPTX, XLSX, images, audio, HTML, CSV, JSON, XML, ZIP, EPUB, and YouTube URLs with proper dependencies.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Complex layouts and low quality scans may not convert cleanly and can require OCR or manual cleanup.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into a pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, use the Python API or scripts to batch convert files and integrate with your workflow.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: Only if you enable AI image descriptions, which call the configured OpenRouter endpoint.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot failures?
faq.answer: Check dependencies for the file format, confirm paths exist, and review script error output.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic converters?
faq.answer: It preserves structure for many formats and supports AI descriptions, which many generic converters do not.
